rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used to form Bunny Triplets (three matching bunnies) as either a Yellow or a Green Congenial Bunny.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used to form Bunny Triplets (three matching bunnies) as either a Yellow or a Blue Gleeful Bunny.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used to form Bunny Triplets (three matching bunnies) as either a Violet or a Yellow Lumbering Bunny.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used to form Bunny Triplets (three matching bunnies) as either a Orange or a Yellow Sinister Bunny.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used to form Bunny Triplets (three matching bunnies) as either a Green or a Blue Timid Bunny.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: When all the carrots are taken from Kaballa’s Market the game is over and The Magic Carrot is revealed.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: When all the carrots are taken from Kaballa’s Market the game is over and The Magic Carrot is revealed.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: When all the carrots are taken from Kaballa’s Market the game is over and The Magic Carrot is revealed.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: When all the carrots are taken from Kaballa’s Market the game is over and The Magic Carrot is revealed.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must feed the amounts shown by the end of its next turn or die.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must feed the amounts shown by the end of its next turn or die.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any Bunny which must feed the amounts rolled by the end of its next turn or die.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 13 to survive. If the bunny survives, then Snowball moves to the next bunny clockwise and increases in strength to Level 14. This cycle continues until a bunny dies.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 14 to survive.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 15 to survive.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 16 to survive.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 01 on all seven dice to survive.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: A Defense Card of 7 Units or higher is needed to eliminate this weapon.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Each die may be rolled three times. Put rolls of six aside. If three sixes are rolled then the player revives three bunnies (of those colors) back from the dead or discard pile (if available).

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: Half color bunnies may be revived as well provided that at least one of the colors match. Free Agent, Specialty bunnies and Celebrity bunnies may not be revived using this card. The maximum number of bunnies that a player may revive is three. Extra rolls of 6 may give a player more color choices, but not more bunnies.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once to connect the fate of two adjacent bunnies. Bunnies share The Heavenly Halo, Clover, Bunny Booster, Containment Suit, and Rank.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: If one bunny is killed, then the other one dies as well. Bunnies separated by a Barrier may not be joined. Any object (a bunny, a Barrier or The Djarnak) placed between two joined bunnies breaks the connection and discards the Fingercuffs.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: After rolling, subtract the lowest die roll from the highest die roll and spend that amount of Dolla at any open market. Must be spent immediately!

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: If all of the stores are closed, then the player is out of luck and the Dolla amount is forfeited.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once to force the players with the Zodiac Cards whose symbols match those on the top and bottom face of the Zodiac die to exchange all Carrots, saved Special, Very Special, and Mysterious Place cards.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text:
May be placed on any one player's bunnies which all roam the board clockwise with Leif Carrotson. Leif (and the bunnies) visit one player per round.
• Red roll high - the player keeps one bunny.
• Violet roll high - Leif and bunnies keep roaming.
• Black roll high - one bunny is thrown overboard and drowns.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: When a player gives this card to an opponent, all of the opponent's bunnies that are down (in The Bunny Circle) are taken on board Leif's ship and moved to the next player clockwise. That player rolls the three dice (Violet, Black and Red). If the Red is the highest roll, then the player is allowed to take (and kee) one of the bunnies and immediately place it down in The Bunny Circle. If the Violet is the highest roll, then all fo the bunnies stay on board and continue to roam. If the Black is the highest roll, then the player chooses one bunny to throw overboard (and into the discard pile). Since Leif Carrotson is a Roaming Red Run card, the ship will move to the next player clockwise once every round. When the ship is empty (no bunnies left) Leif Carrotson is discarded.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed under any bunny. Lucky Clover Octdruple lowers the level of any weapon by eight.

rules.title: Black Cat
rules.text: The Black Cat can remove clover modifiers from a bunny.

rules.title: 50/50 Weapons
rules.text: 50/50 Weapons are not affected by clover modifiers.

rules.title: Gender Weapons
rules.text: Gender Weapons are not affected by clover modifiers.

rules.title: Abduction
rules.text: Clover modifiers are discarded when a bunny is abducted by Area 51 or the Mothership.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: The player may roll the dice as many times as the numerical value of the current month. If the Zodiac is either the player's sign or the current sign and the numbers 2 - 1 - 6 - 10 appear on at least one die each then the player receives all of the remaining Zodiac Cards from the Draw Pile.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text:
While rolling for Precession, a player may not save a die roll from one attempt to the next. All dice must be rolled for each attempt. Since the current age in the zodiac is Pisces, any player rolling the Pisces zodiac sign during any attempt will win Precession automatically regardless of the outcome of the other seven 12-sided dice.

If you are still playing Killer Bunnies® and the Quest for the Magic Carrot in the year 2060, the automatic win zodiac sign will change to Aquarius. Please note that the exact date for the ‘Dawning of the Age of Aquarius’ is not known with any certainty. So please accept the year 2060 as our best bunny guess.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text:
Market is open with New Prices:
7 Dolla - for each Pawn
10 Dolla - for each Bunny
(Bunnies must be Run through)

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Allows a player to take the top three cards (of the highest color rolled) from the Draw Pile and then to discard any surplus cards from his hand.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: If two or more dice roll equally high, then the player may choose three cards of each color from the Draw Pile. A player must save all Kaballa Dolla and Zodiac cards, and use all Play Immediately cards. By the end of his turn, the player must discard any surplus cards from his hand so that he once again has a five-card hand and two cards down (the Bottom and Top Run cards).

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: If any die rolled matches the current day of the month then the player holding the Zodiac Card that matches the symbol rolled on the Zodiac die must discard all possessions, draw new cards and start the game over.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: Zodiac Terminator cannot be played after the 20th day of any month since no die rolled for this card has more than twenty sides.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to take two Defense Cards from Rooney's Weapons Emporium.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: Free Defense may not be used if Rooney’s Weapons Emporium is closed.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used only at Kaballa's Market. Dolla value is determined by the roll. Once rolled the Dolla amount must be spent immediately.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: Gift Certificate may not be used if Kaballa's Market is closed.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once to double the amount of cabbage on any pending Feed The Bunny card.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Allows any one player to protect his bunnies from Plutonium, Cheese Balls, and Anti-Matter Rasins. May be used at any time! (and kept for the duration of the game!)

rules.title: Mysterious Place
rules.text: The player who currently holds the Yellow Ball can control the destiny of this card.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player. Any consequence of death suffered by the player's bunny (or bunnies) will also befall the opponent's bunny (or bunnies). May be used at any time!

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: Operation Spoilsport may be used by a player to avenge only his own bunny (or bunnies). Any consequence of death suffered by the player’s bunny (or bunnies) in The Bunny Circle will also be suffered by the opponent’s bunny (or bunnies) in The Bunny Circle. For example, let’s suppose that an opponent kills a player’s bunny with a Leviathan. The player may use Operation Spoilsport to automatically kill one of the opponent’s bunnies. The player must, however, use Operation Spoilsport before the next player starts his turn. For another example, if the opponent uses the Sea Whiz Mount on the player and kills three of his bunnies, then the player may immediately use Operation Spoilsport to kill up to three of the opponent’s bunnies (if the opponent has three bunnies in The Bunny Circle).

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to upgrade any one die roll from a 12-sided die to a 20-sided die. May be used at any time!

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Every player with at least one Zodiac Card may Choose A Carrot from Kaballa's Market.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: The player who drew Community Carrot chooses the first Carrot, and then Carrots are chosen in a clockwise direction by each qualifying player. If the market runs out of Carrots before each player gets to choose, then the rest of the players are out of luck and the game is over. It is rare (but possible) for the game to end using Community Carrot and for no player to have a bunny in The Bunny Circle. If this should happen,then all players will pretend to have a bunny, the Winning Zodiac sign is not drawn, and the Magic Carrot is revealed.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: While hang gliding for the first time one of your bunnies is caught in a serious down draft!

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: If a player draws a PLAY IMMEDIATELY card but has no bunny in The Bunny Circle, then he must place the card on an opponent’s bunny in The Bunny Circle causing it to die (discarded). This is also true if the player’s only bunny in The Bunny Circle is protected by The Heavenly Halo.

rules.title: Protection
rules.text: The Heavenly Halo and Angel Wings will protect a bunny from any terrible misfortune. The Guardian Angle
